derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from late Latin magneticus, from Latin magneta (see magnet)

entry.def: If something metal is magnetic, it acts like a magnet.
You use magnetic to describe something that is caused by or relates to the force of magnetism.

example.ex: The electrically charged gas particles are affected by magnetic forces.
example.tran: 带电气体粒子会受磁力影响。

entry.def: You use magnetic to describe tapes and other objects which have a coating of a magnetic substance and contain coded information that can be read by computers or other machines.

entry.tran: 引人注目的;有吸引力的;有魅力的
entry.def: If you describe something as magnetic, you mean that it is very attractive to people because it has unusual, powerful, and exciting qualities.

example.ex: ...the magnetic effect of the prosperous German economy on would-be immigrants.
example.tran: 繁荣的德国经济对未来移民的吸引力

example.ex: ...the magnetic pull of his looks and her personality.
example.tran: 他外表的魅力与她个性的魅力

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or caused by magnetism;
2. having the properties of a magnet; i.e. of attracting iron or steel;

sentences.sentence: "the hard disk is covered with a thin coat of magnetic material"
"the needle of a magnetic compass points to the magnetic north pole"

means.word_mean: 5. having the properties of a magnet; the ability to draw or pull;

sentences.sentence: "the knife hung on a magnetic board"

means.word_mean: 6. possessing an extraordinary ability to attract;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……的"; 2. 表名词,"人或科学"; 3. 表名词,"某种药或医学有关"

electron电子+ic……的→adj.电子的
